alert.note: Alert for Bland; Smyth; Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 5:54PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Smyth, southeastern Tazewell and southwestern Bland Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 551 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking clusters of strong thunderstorms near Asberrys, to near Ceres, to near Marion. These storm clusters were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marion... Tazewell... Ceres... Mount Rogers National Recreation Area... Sugar Grove... Burkes Garden... and Nebo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
